newsitem.title: USA: Charges dropped against former Minn. Vikings player.
newsitem.headline: Charges dropped against former Minn. Vikings player.

text.p: A judge on Monday dismissed charges against a former football player whose parents and sister are on trial for allegedly receiving luxury goods stolen from a department store by a hired thief.
Ramsey County Judge Salvador Rosas dropped the charges against James Dick, 32, who played with the Minnesota Vikings, because of mistakes by investigators that he said prejudiced his case.
The trial of his father, wealthy dentist Gerald Dick, 58, his wife Judy, 56, and daughter Stacy Zehren, a 33-year-old lawyer, was ordered to continue.

The case captured nationwide attention after Dayton's Department Store security personnel caught a convicted thief, Gregory Thomas, shoplifting expensive items. He later participated in a sting against the Dick family.
Thomas testified he had shoplifted pricey items such as crystal and expensive clothing for years for the Dick family, often stealing goods they had specifically ordered.
